title: Want To Buy:  WE CONSIGN FIREARMS! TOP DOLLAR PAID!
postcontent:
RAMPART FIREARMS CONSIGNMENT SERVICES
Have an old gun you no longer need? Want to get a gun legally out of your name? Want some quick cash for your used firearm? Want to trade up to a new firearm?
 If so, Rampart Firearms has you covered. 
We will pay you top dollar for your used firearms and we pay on the spot. In addition, we can handle collections of all sizes either for purchase, or we’ll give you a FREE verbal appraisal on your firearms.
In addition, we offer consignment services through our Online Auction service or In-Person sales.
How does it work?
Simply contact us to setup an appointment to bring your gun (or gun collection) to our retail location. We offer in home service for larger collections. One of our skilled appraisers, will sit down with you to appraise the firearm(s), and we’ll make you a cash offer on your firearm(s), or we’ll help you determine a fair starting price for a consignment. Consignments are listed with reserve online for auction and sell to the highest bidder. 
Why is it Safe?
When you sell to Rampart Firearms, you legally transfer any firearm out of your name. For consignments, we protect your identity and act as the contact with the buyer. We store your guns in fire resistant safes while on auction. 
Why is this Easy?
You bring in the guns; we do all the work, and for consignments we mail you a check when your gun sell(s). 
Why is it Legal?
We are bound by all Federal, State and Local firearms laws. So, by selling your gun to Rampart Firearms, it immediately is put into our inventory and is legally transferred out of your name. With consignments, we will ensure that the purchaser of the firearm is legally eligible to purchase it and we provide you with proof of transfer of ownership. 
Why is it Lucrative?
We pay top dollar for used firearms. Consignments are exposed to the hundreds of thousands of potential buyers and selling via auction generates the highest price possible. 
Our consignment fees are as follows:
In person sale ONLY - 15% of the selling price of the item. Fees for other services provided by Rampart Firearms (e.g. repair) or for services provided by third-party vendors are additional and are not included in the consignment fee. 
Online Sale ONLY - 10% commission, plus auction fees. A $10.00 upfront charge for online auction is non-refundable for firearm storage unless firearm sells. All firearms will be listed with the reserve at the consignor’s minimum acceptable price, plus 10%. Auction must be finalized for payment to be released.
Consignment Services include:
•	Basic Cleaning of the Firearm
•	Professional Detailed Photography
•	Comprehensive Descriptions of Item in Ad Copy
•	Answering Questions from Potential Bidders / Buyers
•	All Shipping Charges
•	Validating the Authenticity of Federal Firearms Licenses through the BATFE
•	Licenses / Permits
•	Storage of Firearms in Fire Resistant Safes
•	Collection of Payment
•	Retention of All Documents Pertaining to Sale as Required by the BATFE
So, what are you waiting for? Get rid of that old firearm collecting dust and turn it into cash today!

title: For Sale:  PSL **Price Drop**
postcontent:
Up for sale is my very nice Romanian PSL. It is matching numbers and was manufactured in Romania by CUGIR, not a kit-built rifle. It comes with 5 (10 round) magazines that work just fine. I have put maybe 100 rounds through her and that was mostly PPU 150gr non-corrosive brass-cased ammo. 

The upgraded optic is an 8x42D POSP with an illuminated reticle. The "D" model has larger knobs and an independent focus adjustment. Its a VERY nice scope and is a top of the line fixed-power POSP. It currently utilizes a red diode, but that can be switched out if desired. I purchased it directly from Kalinka Optics and have only fired about 20 rounds with the scope on. 

The synthetic furniture is from Black Horse Arsenal and changes the whole look of this thing. The forearm and gas tube cover were made in the US, and the adjustable buttstock was originally made in the Izmash Arsenal in Russia for an SVD Dragunov. They were imported by BHA and converted to fit the PSL rifles. Therefore it counts as being made in the US as well. I went with this setup not only for the looks, but for the utility. The cheek pad is very functional for using the scope, and it rotates out of the way so you can use iron sights as well.

Included are several extra batteries for the optic, an amber lens cover, the rubber eyepiece, a cleaning cloth, scope bag, instructions manual (in Russian), and importation paperwork for the buttstock. It will be shipped in a lockable hard plastic case.

Looking for cash on this one. Many people have offered very nice rifles and carbines for trade, but not what I'm looking for (which is quite specific) so I'm no longer accepting trades.

These aren't being imported anymore and getting harder and harder to find. Who knows how expensive they'll be in a few years? More and more people are beginning to list these on GunBroker for well over $2000... know that right now, you can't put this setup together for what I'm asking for it. I know what the value is, and I'm not in a rush to sell, so don't try to low-ball me please.

Please know your state's laws as I will not ship to where this rifle is illegal. I plan to ship this directly to your FFL of choice. Buyer pays shipping unless otherwise negotiated.

title: For Sale:  Excellent Remington 700 BDL 7mm 50-year Commemorative with Nikon ProStaff scope.
postcontent:
This gun retails for hundreds more. Grab a piece of history and own a special edition of one of the greatest hunting rifles made. Comes with Nikon ProStaff scope, leather sling  and soft case. This deal cannot be beat! #RR66344A
There's no more fitting way to honor 50 years of bolt-action supremacy than with a Model 700 BDL crafted in the spirit of the very first one Remington released in 1962, in its first chambering: the 7mm Remington Magnum. This rifle's timeless looks and laser-engraved commemorative floorplate make a coveted piece for collectors, but a few shots from the bench will assure you it's built to hunt. Like all Model 700 rifles, this edition is graced with the world-leading out-of-the-box accuracy and reliability that have earned it a place in history as the greatest bolt guns of all time. The handsome "B" grade walnut stock is adorned with Fleur-Di-Lis checkering and white line spacers at the recoil pad, grip cap and fore-end. Rich satin bluing on the receiver and 24" barrel adds the finishing touch. Modern advancements like the X-Mark Pro externally adjustable trigger further support our belief that this is one commemorative rifle you won't be able to keep on a shelf.
Key Features:
24" barrel with adjustable rear and hooded ramp front sight 
Satin-finished "B" grade walnut stock with Fleur-Di-Lis cut checkering
Satin bluing over 24" barreled action 
50-year commemorative laser-engraved hinged floorplate 
X-Mark Pro™ Trigger externally adjustable trigger set at 3 1/2 lbs. from the factory

title: For Sale:  Directed Energy Weapon (non-lethal).  Star-Trek Technology…. Extremely Rare Item
postcontent:
Directed Energy Weapon (non-lethal).  Star-Trek Technology…. Extremely Rare Item

B.E. Meyers Glare Mout Non-Lethal Visual Disruption Laser Kit Product Info 

Normally ONLY sold to approved Military and Law Enforcement Agencies.  There are NO Private Party or Commercial Sales offered by the manufacture.

The B.E. Meyers GLARE MOUT Non-Lethal Visual Disruption Green Laser Weapon Sight D532PM-WPNKIT9 has been designed to be the perfect way to shock and disorient your target. This Green Laser Sight from B.E. Meyers is a non-lethal visual disruption  laser (dazzler, ocular interruption device OID) ideally suited for small-arms weapon integration as well as mobile crew-served applications. When a suspect individual approaches a restricted or controlled area, the B.E. Meyers Glare Mout Visual Disruption Green Tactical Laser is able to hail and warn that person before shots have to be fired. The shockingly bright green dazzler beam on this B.E. Meyers Green Laser sends an irrefutable, multi-lingual, cross-cultural message that you mean business. Reports confirm that the GLARE MOUT has saved numerous lives of both soldiers and non-combatants in Iraq and Afghanistan. The B.E. Meyers Glare Mout Tactical Green Laser Sight is compact and lightweight and is already approved for use by all branches of the U.S. Armed Services.

Features of B.E. Meyers OID GLARE Green Laser Sight:
•	Green dazzler output
•	Lightweight, small profile
•	Fully weapons mountable
•	Weapon shock ruggedized
•	Extended battery life
•	Instant on (no warm-up delay)
•	Beam size prevents collateral lasing
•	Approved by all DoD branches

Specifications for B.E. Meyers Glare Mout Ocular Interruption Device:
Output Power (Visible):	125 mW (maximum)
Wavelength:	532 nm (green)
Laser Classification:	Class 3B
Power Supply:	2 x 123
Dimensions:	7.7 x 1.8 x 1.7 in
Weight (With Batteries):	9.9 oz
NOHD:	18m (.25 s exposure)
Effective Range (day):	> 200 m

Package Contents:
•	B.E. Meyers GLARE MOUT Non-Lethal Visual Disruption Green Laser Weapon Sight 
•	Padded Molle Case
•	Weapon Mount
•	Pressure Switch
•	Operator’s Manual
•	Operating Batteries

According to the US Government, non-lethal Optical Distractors (ocular interrupters or “laser dazzlers”) are visible (green) laser devices that have temporary optical effects on human targets.  These types of non-blinding laser devices use highly directional optical energy to support several non-lethal missions, including: 

	Temporarily overwhelming an adversary's visual sense by emitting a compelling glare source.
	Providing an unequivocal non-verbal warning.
	Providing the target an opportunity to clarify intent.

Although these mission capabilities are generic to any high-intensity light source, laser light sources, versus LEDs, are ideal for non-lethal applications, as the optical energy is collimated and very directional.  This allows the Operator to precisely deliver the laser energy at long ranges, while minimizing the total power output and minimizing collateral effects to other bystanders.

A Dazzler Laser allows the Operator to temporarily impair the vision of the target(s) by temporarily eliminating their ability to see, engage and/or effectively target the Operator by overwhelming their visual sense.  Due to the Operator’s ability to adjust the range of engagement from 1-2400 meters (model dependent), the Operator can visually impair, warn, assess, deter, suppress, illuminate, target, hail and warn, and/or communicate with the target(s) potentially avoiding an unnecessary escalation to more lethal engagements.

NOHD is an acronym that stands for Nominal Ocular Hazard Distance.  The NOHD represents what a laser system’s eye safety zone is. For example, if a laser system has an NOHD of 20 meters, the system cannot be used eye safe from the exit point of the system out to 20 meters in range.  Beyond 20 meters, no eye damage will occur.

The SR-556 offers Ruger's legendary rugged reliability and comes factory standard with a host of accessories that today's shooters demand. The SR-556 employs a patent-pending, chrome-plated, two-stage piston driven operating system that provides the user with a cleaner, cooler running, reliable firearm that is truly state-of-the-art. The chrome-lined gas block and chrome-plated piston and regulator work together to provide a smooth power delivery stroke to the bolt carrier. The by-products of the gas system are vented out the bottom of the gas block, away from the bolt carrier, keeping the action clean and free from contaminants.

Specs:
The Magpul UBR (Utility / Battle Rifle), U.S. Patent 6651371, is a fully-featured, adjustable buttstock for the AR15/M16. Unlike typical collapsing stocks, this modular design offers the stability of a fixed stock with consistent cheek weld in any position. Seven-position length-of-pull (LOP) adjustment is quickly executed with gross motor movement while the integral preset system allows direct access to a preferred position. A robust lock mechanism and multi-shell construction increase durability under severe impact conditions experienced during malfunction clearing and accommodates large-bore AR calibers with ease. The UBR also provides extra counterbalance weight to improve handling on full-length rifles and weapons with muzzle-heavy accessories or bull-barrels. Optional components such as dual-side sling mounts and metal strike plate allow the UBR to adapt to the mission at hand.

Compact chest harness with (6) internal M4 magazine slots.

BLOCS: Battle Load Carry System
Designed in conjunction with the Army’s most elite units, BLOCS was constructed with durability, high mobility and versatility in mind. BLOCS is a universal system that can be figured out to suit any special operations mission. From direct action to vehicle patrols, even rural/long range operations. BLOCS can be modified to suit the individual soldier’s preference or specific situation by simply adding or removing pouches. Our tactical pouch line utilizes 500 Denier® Cordura. All of our pouches are constructed from this material because we have found it to be approximately 40% lighter than the 1000 Denier®, yet suffering only a 10% reduction in durability. All items in our BLOCS line utilize S.O.TECH's Flex-Tab(patent pending). Flex-Tab™ is a simple, safe, and strong system that integrates 100% with all current issue PALS packs, pouches and vests. In addition, it allows for a faster and stronger pouch attachment than other designs. And with our products, they come with a lifetime warranty.

postcontent:
This is a bit of an interesting item because I got this from a soldier brought it back with him from the war in Afghanistan.  He said it was on his rifle throughout his tour and has seen a lot of combat.  He said that he had been through some really rough missions and always kept this carry handle for luck, even switching it onto a new gun when he had to swap them out.  When he came home he kept it as a memento of his time overseas but later decided to include it in a package sale of some items I bought from him.  He wanted me to know the story behind it when he gave it to me and I want to make sure whoever buys this knows it's something that had special meaning to him.  

It is a bit rough as you can imagine but fully usable.  Would make a great addition to your AR and comes with an interesting story. title: For Sale:  Beretta PX4 Storm Low Profile Safety and Slide Catch Levers, Decocker Lever
postcontent:
I bought this from Beretta - it's just been sitting in my drawer - it's brand new. This cit consists of three parts: low profile deckocker levers (left and right) and a low profile slide catch lever. 

This kit makes your PX4 much narrower and it doesn't hurt as much to rack the slide. It also converts your Type F to a Type G...read below.

Most PX4’s that are sold in outdoor stores are the Type F. 

How can you tell if you have a Type F or a Type G?
The difference is in what happens when you activate the decocker lever.

Type F: activate the leverl and it stays down – the gun is on “Safe”
Type G: activate the lever and it pops back up – there is no manual Saftey.
	Type F: Single and double-action. Decocker. Manual safety.
	Double/single action. 
	Ambidextrous manual safety on the slide with hammer decocking function, automatic firing pin block safety.
	When you activate the decocker lever, it stays down – the gun is on “Safe” until you remove the safety by pushinh the safety lever/decocker lever (one and the same lever) back up to the fire position.
	Type G: Single and double-action. Decocker. No manual safety.
	Double/single action. 
	Ambidextrous manual lever on the slide with hammer decocking function with the return of the lever to the firing position, automatic firing pin block safety.
	When you activate the decocker lever, drops the hammer (decocking) but then it springs back up. The lever ONLY functions as a decocker, not a safety. When you activate the decoker lever, it automatically returns to the "fire" position and cannot be locked in the "safe" position.
	Many prefer the Type G function because the gun is always ready to use. You don’t have to think about the safety lever position. Just pull the trigger and bang. With the Type F – if you left the safety on (lever down) and you need your gun for an emergency, it will not work until you push the safety lever back to fire. For this reason many prefer the Type G function. Because the decocker lever always snaps back to the “fire” position – you are always ready to shoot.

	Conversion from F to G instructions: http://www.berettaforum.net/vb/showthread.php?t=13509&page=3

Pistol is fitted with Meprolight green on green night sites only 2 years old, purchase also includes extra set of green on red fiber optic sights. OEM extended slide stop lever and OEM smooth combat trigger are installed trigger breaks at 5#. This 19C is set up to allow the operator to shoot well with minimal effort and includes 1 magazine. Credit cards accepted, proper identification and or CCW license is required with all purchases or trades.

title: For Sale:  Remington Model 1889 Side-by-side Shotgun
postcontent:
12 gauge.  Exposed hammers. Probably a grade #2 with fine twist barrels. Action lock-up is loose, left barrel hammer does not stay cocked. Barrels show extensive pitting on interior. Outside, the gun has a nice brown coloration that shows its age - wood is in OK condition, with dents. scratches, and a few small "chunks" missing around the action. All parts seem to be original, with matching hammers. Overall, it would make a nice wall hanger ( fireplace gun). A non-shooter in current condition. Serial number puts manufacture date somewhere between 1900 - 1908 according to Remington website.
Will entertain a reasonable offer.

B.E. Meyers Glare Mout Non-Lethal Visual Disruption Laser Kit Product Info

Normally ONLY sold to approved Military and Law Enforcement Agencies. There are NO Private Party or Commercial Sales offered by the manufacture.

The B.E. Meyers GLARE MOUT Non-Lethal Visual Disruption Green Laser Weapon Sight D532PM-WPNKIT9 has been designed to be the perfect way to shock and disorient your target. This Green Laser Sight from B.E. Meyers is a non-lethal visual disruption laser (dazzler, ocular interruption device OID) ideally suited for small-arms weapon integration as well as mobile crew-served applications. When a suspect individual approaches a restricted or controlled area, the B.E. Meyers Glare Mout Visual Disruption Green Tactical Laser is able to hail and warn that person before shots have to be fired. The shockingly bright green dazzler beam on this B.E. Meyers Green Laser sends an irrefutable, multi-lingual, cross-cultural message that you mean business. Reports confirm that the GLARE MOUT has saved numerous lives of both soldiers and non-combatants in Iraq and Afghanistan. The B.E. Meyers Glare Mout Tactical Green Laser Sight is compact and lightweight and is already approved for use by all branches of the U.S. Armed Services.

Features of B.E. Meyers OID GLARE Green Laser Sight:
• Green dazzler output
• Lightweight, small profile
• Fully weapons mountable
• Weapon shock ruggedized
• Extended battery life
• Instant on (no warm-up delay)
• Beam size prevents collateral lasing
• Approved by all DoD branches

Specifications for B.E. Meyers Glare Mout Ocular Interruption Device:
Output Power (Visible): 125 mW (maximum)
Wavelength: 532 nm (green)
Laser Classification: Class 3B
Power Supply: 2 x 123
Dimensions: 7.7 x 1.8 x 1.7 in
Weight (With Batteries): 9.9 oz
NOHD: 18m (.25 s exposure)
Effective Range (day): > 200 m

Package Contents:
• B.E. Meyers GLARE MOUT Non-Lethal Visual Disruption Green Laser Weapon Sight
• Padded Molle Case
• Weapon Mount
• Pressure Switch
• Operator’s Manual
• Operating Batteries

According to the US Government, non-lethal Optical Distractors (ocular interrupters or “laser dazzlers”) are visible (green) laser devices that have temporary optical effects on human targets. These types of non-blinding laser devices use highly directional optical energy to support several non-lethal missions, including:

 Temporarily overwhelming an adversary's visual sense by emitting a compelling glare source.
 Providing an unequivocal non-verbal warning.
 Providing the target an opportunity to clarify intent.

Although these mission capabilities are generic to any high-intensity light source, laser light sources, versus LEDs, are ideal for non-lethal applications, as the optical energy is collimated and very directional. This allows the Operator to precisely deliver the laser energy at long ranges, while minimizing the total power output and minimizing collateral effects to other bystanders.

A Dazzler Laser allows the Operator to temporarily impair the vision of the target(s) by temporarily eliminating their ability to see, engage and/or effectively target the Operator by overwhelming their visual sense. Due to the Operator’s ability to adjust the range of engagement from 1-2400 meters (model dependent), the Operator can visually impair, warn, assess, deter, suppress, illuminate, target, hail and warn, and/or communicate with the target(s) potentially avoiding an unnecessary escalation to more lethal engagements.

NOHD is an acronym that stands for Nominal Ocular Hazard Distance. The NOHD represents what a laser system’s eye safety zone is. For example, if a laser system has an NOHD of 20 meters, the system cannot be used eye safe from the exit point of the system out to 20 meters in range. Beyond 20 meters, no eye damage will occur.

The Manufacturer’s Website (you can download product specs)
http://www.bemeyers.com/index.php?option=com_product&catid=36&id=12

Watch The Manufacturer’s Video
http://www.bemeyers.com/videos/glare_products.html

Dazzler (weapon) From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dazzler_(weapon)

OpticsPlanet.com sells this unit to Military/Law Enforcement Agencies (on sale) for $6,295, instead of the suggested $8585.
http://www.opticsplanet.com/b-e-meyers-glare-mout-kit-original-laser-complete-non-lethal-visual-disruption-l.html

In 2010 the only one of these you could find being sold to the public was selling for $3500. It sold in 2-days.
http://www.armslist.com/posts/63620/toledo-ohio-rifles-for-sale-trade--glare-mout-laser-dazzler

It is a Federal felony to aim a laser at an airplane or helicopter. This laser same as all lasers can cause eye damage at short ranges and should be used carefully. title: For Sale:  Glock 30sf gen3 w/ 10mm barrel complete urban or forest carry package
postcontent:
Alright guys, selling my carry package, it is perfect for anyone in the northwest. The compact 10+1 45acp is the ultimate urban carry gun, and then you can swap over to the extended 10mm barrel for 44 magnum performance for when you find yourself exploring the mountains and stumble across an angry bear or cougar.  

Up for sale is my used/like new Glock 30sf w/ Factory Night Sights. Approximately 1,000 rounds through it, never had a single fail to fire.

With it is a pretty extensive list of upgrades and accessories:
1 Safariland ALS paddle/belt holster OWB
1 Glock sport holster OWB
1 Comptac Minotaur MTAC holster IWB
1 N82 Professional locking holster IWB
2 Safariland magazine holsters OWB
3 Glock 30 10rd .45acp magazines
2 Glock 21 13rd .45acp magazines
2 A&G magazine extension sleeves for .45acp
1 Stormlake 10mm extended+ported conversion barre
2 Glock 29 10rd 10mm magazines
2 Glock 20 15rd 10mm magazines
2 A&G magazine extension sleeves for 10mm 
1 extended slide release lever (Installed)
1 extended slide lock lever (Installed)
2 stock slide release levers
1 extended magazine release
1 additional slide cover plate
1 slide plate removal tool
1 Brass Stacker 17 lb stainless recoil spring assembly
1 Ghost Ultimate trigger system (Installed)
1 Wolff guide rod and 23 lb spring set (For taming the mighty 10mm)

I've had this gun for just over 3 years now, and have been slowly adding to the upgrades ever since. This has been my everyday carry gun and my IDPA competition gun and I have never had a single issue. 

If you find yourself still on the fence I highly suggest taking a look at this article by the master Massad Ayoob
http://www.personaldefenseworld.com/2013/09/do-it-all-45/ 

My only reason for selling is that I find myself in need of cash for the holidays.

Please don't try to lowball me guys, I do have a pretty reasonable idea of what all of this is worth, but if you have reasonable offers I am willing to listen.

As far as trades, I'm not really looking for anything, but if you want to make an offer the worst I can say is no.

I do have a bit of 45acp and 10mm defensive ammo as well as some 45acp target Winchester ammo that I would be willing to let go as well

Let me know if you want any additional pictures

Email or text is the best way to reach me

title: For Sale/Trade:  Kel-Tec PF-9 - 9mm - As New In Box
postcontent:
After much debate I have decided to sell my black over gray Kel-Tec concealed carry PF-9 with exactly 49 rounds fired. My dilemma was whether to keep this gun or my Kahr 9mm of the same type. This gun shoots great, not a single FTF, FTE or misfire, and I ran both FMJ and hollow point catridges through it. It is slimmer than the Kahr but slightly longer from front to back. It was a tough decision, basically a tossup, but at some point I finally had to make a choice.

Here's the deal: MY FFL charges $30 for the background check (it's hard to find an FFL to do a BC, let alone at a reasonable fee.) You come to Longmont, we go to his place and you pay him for the BC, and if you pass I pay you back the $30 and you get the package for $265 net. If you fail the check you're out the thirty bucks. Price is firm at $265; I'd be surprised if you can find it on Armslist cheaper with fees and sales tax if you buy from a dealer. Thanks for looking and have a Merry Christmas.

title: For Sale:  Sig P229R .40 - 9 mags - 3 holsters + ammo
postcontent:
This is a great package for a new gun to CCW or IDPA/IPSC competition.

For sale is a used Sig P229R (purchased in 2007) in .40 S&W. This handgun is DA/SA, and I have swapped out the factory hollow aluminum guide rod with a Bedair stainless guide rod. This adds a tiny amount of weight to the front, so it helps slightly with recoil and is a bit stronger than the factory guide rod - but is mainly just more attractive than the original one. I do also have the factory blue box the gun originally came in.

I also am including 9 magazines holding 12 rounds each for the handgun. Each one of them has a brand new Wolff extra strength spring in them.

The three holsters included are:

1 High Noon Custom - Slide Guard (with lining) OWB cowhide holster. This is a custom made high ride holster with belt loops that fit up to 1 3/4" belts. It has an adjustable tension screw to fine tune the strength of the retention on the holster. If you have never experienced a custom leather holster - it is AMAZING! Mass produced holsters do not have the detailed boning that custom holsters have which does not retain the handgun as well as custom holsters. If you have ever experienced a mass produced leather holster, you know that the leather becomes well-worked and soft within a month or so, but you don't have any of that with the High Noon. It will be just as rigid as it was when it was made forever.

The second holster is a Bianchi IWB concealment holster. I have carried the Sig in an "appendix carry" position as well as 3:30-4:00 and it works very well.

The third and final holster is a great range holster. It is the very popular Blackhawk Serpa holster. It includes both the belt attachment and the quick attach pancake attachment.

I will include 100 rounds of Federal HST JHP self-defense ammunition with this purchase. 

I live in Puyallup, but I will be in Spokane this weekend for the holidays and can meet in the area if you are on the east side.

title: For Sale/Trade:  800 Rounds Federal HST .40S&W JHP
postcontent:
Best CCW Ammo you can buy!

For sale/trade is 800 rounds of Federal HST 155gr JHP for a .40S&W. I am asking far less than retail for cash offers. 

Federal released its Hydra-Shok line of ammunition to capture the law enforcement market years ago, and while it was a good round - it proved troublesome when going through barriers before reaching its target - clogging much of the time.

Federal corrected the problem by introducing a line known as HST, and it was tested extensively by the FBI upon its release in .40 caliber, and adopted as their ammunition after blowing the tests out of the water. This is currently the only ammunition I will carry as I feel like it is the only ammunition to hold a candle to the famous "Black Talon".

It's easy to find the much less desirable Hydra-Shok ammunition on the shelf, and many people are intrigued by the "post" inside the hollow point. If you do the research, and I suggest you do, you will find that HST is extremely tough to beat.

That's why HST has almost never (in my experience) been for sale on the shelves at your local gun shop - I have only ever found it online, for a premium price, and in small or limited quantities. I have recently switched to a different caliber for my preferred CCW and cannot find anywhere that sells HST in bulk, must less a place with a single box in stock right now.

I live in Puyallup, but will be willing to drive a reasonable distance to meet - or even ship if you want to pay for shipping.

Take a look here for FBI Protocol test results on this ammunition
http://le.atk.com/ammunition/federal/handgun/details.aspx?id=567

title: For Sale:  Hy Hunter - 44 mag SAA clone
location: SW Fort Wayne, Fort Wayne, Indiana
postcontent:
I have a somewhat unique piece of old Western Americana, in the form of a Hy Hunter single action 44 magnum revolver.  Gun was manufactured by JP Sauer and Sohns (yup, now the later part of Sig-Sauer), in the 1960-70s.  Apparently, these were used in many of the older Western shows and movies for prop guns.

Revolver is nickel plated with 4-5/8" barrel, fixed sights, and those ugly pearlite grips.  Gun is in good shape, with some dull spots on the finish, likely taken out by polishing.  There are also two screw heads that are buggered beyond removeable.  Parts are still available through Numrich online and many parts are interchangeable with Colt SAA revolvers and the clones.

Contact via armslist email and I can text photos and more info as needed.  Thanks.
